data.name: Saranac Blueberry Blonde Ale
data.description: Saranac Blueberry Blonde Ale is a traidtional blonde ale with a kick of juicy blueberry.  You'll notice a light golden haze from wheat malt and oats and a low hop bitterness, which really shows off the fruit.  With a medium-light body and fresh blueberry flavor, we're sure we've captured refreshment in a bottle!

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

breweries.name: 10 Barrel Brewing Company
breweries.description: We started back in 2006 with three guys and one simple vision.. brew beer, drink beer and have fun doing it. Since then we have grown but our focus will always stay the same... Rough morning? Grab a beer. Powder day? The "gone skiing" sign goes up. Too hot to work? Mandatory company float. You get the picture... here's to living it up with a beer in hand!

data.name: Sassy Blonde

data.name: Savour Blonde
data.description:
Hops, yeast and spices.

Paying homage to the brewers of Belgium with their skill, creativity and passion for brewing excellence, our Blonde ale combines the freshest hops with Belgian yeast.

The simplistic malt base allow the yeast and hops to shine through with dazzling effect. Upfront hop fruitiness and yeast spices dominate the aroma and are complimented by a bitter mouth-feel generating a refreshing finish.

breweries.name: Savour Beer
breweries.description: Obsessive in our search for exceptional flavours we are on a mission to raise people’s expectations of beer and make others as passionate about great beer as we are. We believe that things made by hand in small batches taste better. That’s why we combine the best, natural ingredients in tiny batches to create the best tasting beer we possibly can. We strive to create beautiful, handmade beer packed full of flavour. Beer designed to accompany good food, good friendship and to serve as one of life’s little pleasures.

data.name: Schlapppeseppel Landbier
data.description: Schlapppeseppel Landbier stands out by its copper colour. This unfiltrated speciality is naturally cloudy and has a full-bodied and harmonic first sip and surprises with a final note of fresh and roasted bread aromas. This is due to the traditional malted barley.
data.foodPairings: This beer goes well with cold meals, cold homemade meats, aromatic cheese and also with roasts or dark chocolate.

breweries.name: Schlappeseppel
breweries.description:
In 1631, King Gustav from Sweden took the city of Aschaffenburg. Legend has it, that the sweedish troops soon found out, that there was no single drop of beer in the barrels, while preparing the Johannisburg castle for the royal court.

As it happened, there was a foot soldier by the name of Joseph Lögler amongst this troops, who was proficient in brewing beer. The short form of Joseph is “Sepp” or “Seppel” for “little Joseph”. Obviously, by making beer the brave soldier Seppel was of much better use to the King of Sweden, because he was going lame due to an old battlefield injury to the leg. The injury was the cause for his nickname “Schlappe-Seppel”.

The beer of the brave soldier was very well received because of its excellence and very soon after the first brew, he had to make more beer. In the end, he stayed behind in Aschaffenburg, after the Swedish troops had left. He settled as a cooper and brewer. The Schlappeseppel Beer was born.

breweries.name: Pecan Street Brewing
breweries.description:
Pecan Street Brewing and Restaurant — a place to visit with old friends and make new ones! We are located in Johnson City, in the heart of the scenic Texas Hill Country, at 106 E. Pecan — directly across from the historic Courthouse.

We feature hand-crafted beers brewed on premise for the freshest beer you can drink! And for your friends who might prefer a glass of wine, we also have Texas Wines! 

Our menu includes brick oven pizzas, burgers and more, using fresh and local ingredients.

There is live music every Friday and Saturday night, with Sunday being the open mic night!

breweries.name: Central State Brewing
breweries.description:
Central State explores the delicate art of yeast interaction and cultivation in an experimental process as a third wave brewery dedicating themselves to 100% Brett brewing.

Founded by a technically-minded team with an experienced brewer, Central State aims to contribute to the innovation and knowledge-sharing culture that has defined this new generation of American brewing through experimentation, collaboration, and artisanal gypsy brewing.

Central State Brewing Co. is part of a renaissance of craft-minded producers helping revitalize small and mid-size cities across the midwest, sharing their inventiveness with small pockets of like-minded drinkers across the country who are looking for unique flavors and textures in their beer.

data.name: Sellwood Lager
data.description: A Golden Session beer in which simplicity is key. This lager is light, crisp, and drinkable. Made with Northwest ingredients, this beer was crafted to be universally enjoyable for any occasion.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.name: Seltrecht Pilsner
data.description: Don't be scared of the menacingly Germanic name... This Blonde lager is as friendly as it is highly sessionable. Brewed with Weyermann Pilsner malt, gently hopped, and dry hopped with German Tettnanger hops, and layered for over 8 weeks with Danish lager yeast, this pilsner is incredibly clean and crisp, perfect for a summer day.

breweries.name: Flat Tail Brewing Co
breweries.description: Started in 2010 in Corvallis, OR, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Flat Tail Brewing started with a small 6 barrel system. 4 years later Brewer/Owner Dave Marliave is creating some of the best beers in Oregon.  From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!

data.name: Send Help
data.description: Send Help was made in collaboration with Randy Ploesser, Todd Bratrud, and Send Help Skateboards. It is an extremely crushable, dry-hopped blonde ale. Pouring straw in color with a crisp bitterness and an abundance of hop aroma, Send Help is the go-to beer for summer.

The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

Having studied film in his early college years, he always had an eye for seeing things differently. In fact, that creative thinking enabled his career in technology, but his artistic expression was still missing. So one day he decided to try his hand in making his own beer. Of course, he couldn't allow himself to follow the recipe

data.name: Sheet Metal Blonde
data.description: A white or wheat ale that is light in body and color with a hazy appearance that is true to the style. Background spices are bitter orange peel, coriander and chamomile. Iron Metal (or Sheet to us) Blonde was a tough woman and a close friend of Dirty Helen back in the ’30s.

breweries.name: Spoetzl Brewery
breweries.description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

breweries.name: Redchurch Brewery
breweries.description: The Redchurch Brewery strives to create uncompromising modern beers. Our beers are distinctive and adventurous, bottle conditioned to allow them time to mature and grow. We never filter or pasteurise so that the depth of flavour and complexity we work hard to produce is preserved. We don’t tolerate bland flavorless beer and neither should you. We hope you enjoy redchurch beer as much as we do.

data.name: Show Me Your Roots
data.description: Blonde? Brunette? Red Head? Hell, we don’t care! Neither will you after enjoying this crisp and refreshing blonde ale. We use our English Yeast strain to give this beer a nice malt character while balancing it out with just the right amount of Cascade hops. Show us your roots, and we’ll show you ours!

data.name: Shticky Blonde
data.description: Derek started working on this particular recipe about 4 years ago. It started as a lager style, but switched to a Kolsch Ale style about 2 years ago. The finished product has not changed much over the years. Golden color, light carbonation, malty tones, without much hoppiness. Currently runs around 6% ABV. There is a presence of honey, but ever so slightly. The finish is very nice, soft, and light. Every sip begs for another.

breweries.name: 192 Brewing Company
breweries.description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.

data.name: Side Pocket for a Toad
data.description:
An old Hertfordshire saying alluding to the uselessness of anything. Although now sadly passed into disuse, we at Tring Brewery are leading the campaign to restore this wonderful old expression to its rightful place in popular parlance.

Unmistakable citrus notes from only the best Cascade hops balanced with a floral aroma and crisp dry finish make this straw coloured ale a fantastic session beer.

breweries.name: Tring Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1992 Tring Brewery has established itself as one of the leading breweries in Hertfordshire. In addition to their core products that include the multi award winning Jack O'Legs, Side Pocket for a Toad, Colley's Dog and Death or Glory the brewery also produces seasonal ales and monthly specials. From it's 30BB plant these are distributed across the UK and sold from their on site brewery shop.

data.name: Sif's Blonde
data.description: Who is Sif, you say?  According to Norse mythology, Sif is a goddess and none other than the wife of Thor.  Thor is regarded as the god of thunder, rain and farming and is often depicted with his large hammer, named Mjolnir, with which he protected mankind.  So what does Sif have to do with the beer you’re drinking?  Sif was a blonde haired beauty, the goddess of grain and embodies the essence of our blonde ale, brewed to a light straw color, displaying the flavors of bread and grain.  We add two late additions of hops to bring forth the light citrus aroma.  What better way to name a beer than after the Norse goddess?

breweries.name: Devil's Canyon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Devil’s Canyon Brewing Company, located in the heart of the San Francisco bay area peninsula, produces award-winning, sustainably handcrafted beer and root beer centered on the most premium ingredients.

Prior to the 1780’s the canyon portion of Belmont and San Carlos was known as “la Canada del Diablo” or Devil’s Canyon.

Since opening our doors in 2001, Devil’s Canyon Brewing Co. has won over 35 awards for our craft beers. San Francisco Bay Area A-List readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Favorite Bay Area Brewery” in 2013 and “Best Bay Area Beer Bar” in 2014. San Francisco Business Journal readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Best Beer” in 2014. Also in 2014, the brewery was awarded “Business of the Year” by the City of San Carlos and the San Carlos Chamber of Commerce.

data.name: Silver Anniversary Ale
data.description: On November 17th, 1989, John McDonald loaded a keg of Boulevard Pale Ale into the back of his pickup and drove to a restaurant a few blocks down the street. Scarcely 24 hours later and 650 miles away Doug Odell loaded a keg of Odell Golden Ale into the back of his pickup and... you get the idea. They were the first kegs of beer either of them ever sold, but they wouldn't be the last. This golden copper ale celebrates 25 years of brewing with an ample body of caramel-toffee malt balanced by piney hop notes. Here's a toast to working hard and sticking with it. Cheers!

style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale

breweries.name: Boulevard Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to Boulevard Brewing Company, the Midwest's home for fine ales and lagers since 1989. Boulevard's mission is simple: to produce fresh, flavorful beers using the finest traditional ingredients and the best of both old and new brewing techniques.

data.name: Simmons Island Imperial Blonde
data.description: A big American blonde ale, loaded up with honey for a unique finish and light mouthfeel. The beer has a copper color and rich sweet flavor profile, balanced by Willamette hops.

breweries.name: Rustic Road Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Kenosha's Oldest Brewery
Stepping in to Rustic Road Brewing Company is a unique experience, right in the heart of downtown Kenosha. We make our own beers right on site in small batches in the old Wisconsin artisan style. We pride ourselves in being unique enough to stand out, but unassuming enough to be enjoyable by everyone. We love great beer and love to share it with Kenosha!

data.name: Single Blonde
data.description:
Zipline Brewing Co.’s Single Blonde highlights a single hop variety used throughout the brewing process.  Centennial hops, traditionally featured in IPAs, are used in the kettle, whirlpool, and the conditioning tank to create an intriguing hop character not typically found in blonde ales.  This golden session ale is fermented just above lager temps to create a smooth, easy drinking beer to finish out the summer.  

Hops: Centennial

Malts: Pils, Carahell, Vienna, & locally sourced, organic Rolled White Wheat

data.name: Single Blonde
data.description: Using only one type of malt, and a single variety of hops for both flavour and aroma, this moreish session strength beer is one of our most popular brews. A light, herbal aroma gives way to a slightly dry bitterness with hints of vanilla in the finish.

breweries.name: Magic Hat Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Saturnalian Saga of Magic Hat began in 1994 when our first batch of beer was brewed in a funky little space on Flynn Avenue, in Burlington, Vermont.  Dozens of beers and a brewery later, the Vermont brewery finds itself reaching more than 30 states with its unique take on classic styles.  Magic Hat continues to be a leader in craft beer and is currently the only craft brewer putting a performance in every bottle.

Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. breweries.name: 38 State Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We started out years ago brewing in our garage. Friends and family would always come by to hang out, drink our beer, socialize and watch whatever game was on. Soon our garage was filled with so many people we decided to find a bigger one and open it up to everyone! We took a chance and opened a nano-brewery and tasting room. Now we can offer our beer to current and future friends in our community! Visit our website for our beer menu, more info and updates. www.38statebrew.com

We're located in Littleton, Colorado. So whether you're a local or just passing through, please stop by, take a load off and sample some of our tasty brews. Trust us... you will not be disappointed! Cheers!!

data.name: Siren
data.description:
Nothing was more alluring and seductive than the songs of the Sirens, who summoned passing sailors that were quick to meet their demise at the hand of these deceptive temptresses. Our recipe will summon you to take sip after sip of this sweet nectar recipe.

Impossible to have just one. Siren uses Cascade hops and a touch of honey malt to create a smooth malty mouthfeel and a crisp carbonating finish.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

breweries.name: Quaff On! Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto!

At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette.
Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans.
When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility.
Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago.
Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment.

"Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare

data.name: Skaha Summer Ale
data.description:
This Blonde Ale is a refreshing, thirst quenching beer that is perfect for a hot Okanagan day. Using different hops each year will give this ale a distinct flavour and unique aroma. The addition of white wheat malt and German Ale yeast create a body that is soft and delicate with a crisp, dry finish.

Skaha Lake is one of the freshwater lakes that surround Penticton in the beautiful Okanagan Valley. Time honoured summer traditions such as rock climbing and cliff diving have made the Skaha Bluffs world famous.

breweries.name: Cannery Brewing
breweries.description:
Located amidst the breathtaking scenery of Penticton, British Columbia, Canada, our micro-brewery produces individually crafted fine ales and lagers of unmistakable complexity and balance. This flavour is the result of wonderful combinations of premium quality malted grains and carefully chosen Pacific Northwest hops.

All of our beers are created with carefully selected and scrutinized ingredients. We use the finest hops and grains and only the finest yeast strains. Our brews are all natural. They contain no preservatives and are not pasteurized. You get a fresh, crisp taste every time.

data.name: Skinny Dipper Golden Ale
data.description: Golden in color with a malty aroma and light frothy head. Easy drinking medium bodied summer ale with a slight caramel flavor customary when using Vienna malt. The finish is crisp and clean with very little hop bitterness. Perfect for the beach or sitting on the boardwalk and watching the boats go by.

breweries.description: Your Port Huron craft beer destination! 20 beers on tap, all the time, from our own brewery and other great breweries from around the Country.

data.name: Sky Blue Golden Ale
data.description: For those desiring a lighter beer that still has hand-crafted integrity, this beer is a Kolsch style ale made famous in its namesake city of Cologne (Koln in German). This thirst-quenching brew is spritzy, not too malty, with the pleasing aroma of imported Hallertauer hops. While fermented warm like all ales, Kolsch beer undergoes a cold aging period like a lager which results in a brew that is complex yet easy to drink.

breweries.name: Carolina Brewery
breweries.description:
Carolina Brewery is a locally-owned brewery and restaurant that has drawn international attention for its handcrafted beers, Our award-winning signature beers include Flagship IPA (Gold Medal, Great American Beer Festival), Copperline Amber Ale (Gold Medal, World Beer Championships), Sky Blue Golden Ale (Silver Medal, World Beer Championships), and Oatmeal Porter. We also offer a rotating list of seasonal brews. Our beers are now available on tap and in growlers and cans throughout North Carolina, so ask for them by name at your favorite bar, restaurant, or grocery store!

At our brewpubs in Chapel Hill and Pittsboro NC, you’ll discover authentic tastes in the glass and on the plate, a casual yet upscale atmosphere and affordable prices. Whether you’re looking for a place to grab a fresh beer with friends, enjoy a delicious meal, or host your next party, you’ve come to the right place. Carolina Brewery has been voted Best Brewpub in the Southeast by Brewpub magazine, and Best Burger in the Triangle by Independent Magazine and the readers of The Daily Tar Heel. But above all, we value the opinions of our customers, who cast their vote every time they return to our restaurant. We hope to see you soon. Cheers!

Proudly owned and operated by UNC alumni!

breweries.name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse
breweries.description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery!  We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales.  We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world.  We use hops that are grown all over the world as well.  If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients.  We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers.  We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.

breweries.name: TwoDEEP Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Ever since our Grand Opening in August 2014, we’ve been on a mission to brew passionately handcrafted beer, to cultivate an atmosphere that brings people together, and to have fun doing so! We look at our beer not just as a beverage, but as a lifestyle.  We choose the better things in life—family, friends, community, and obviously incredible craft beer.

At our downtown Indianapolis location, we are a malt-forward production brewery and a destination TapRoom for craft beer enthusiasts of all kinds.

Having originated from home brewing, we want to make sure that our ideals and our close connection to our beer never get lost—no matter how big the system may be.  We will strive to stay true to our roots and continue to make beer that’s never compromised.

breweries.description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

data.description: Pale gold single malt, single hop beer. Light and balanced. Lemon, orange, and grassy hop flavors on top of a hint of sweetness and cracker character from the malt. A smooth and refreshing beer that's easy to like!

breweries.name: Galactic Coast Brewing
breweries.description:
We are excited to join the beer revolution in Texas that is changing the state's beer culture as more Texans graduate from pale, watery swill to the new wave of rich, hand-crafted brews full of flavor, personality & creativity.

We are avid, if not aggressive, craft beer enthusiasts and proud to return commercial brewing to Galveston County, which has a tradition of famous breweries dating to the 1800s although none in more than 30 years.

Our model is as different as our self-built brewery, which features a 100% electric (Green) brewhouse. We leveraged enthusiasm and revolutionary thinking to overcome our unwillingness to burn extensive capital.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

data.name: Sol Hominis (The Sun Of Man)
data.description: Our Belgian Golden Strong Ale is a true “four C” ale – crisp, clear, clean, and complex. The aroma and flavor are a perfect balance between bright fruits, lightly sweet malt, and floral hop bitterness. It is medium bodied , highly carbonated, and has a refreshingly dry finish. A devilishly delectable ale.
data.foodPairings: Try pairing with savory hors d’oeuvres, herb spiced foods like Middle Eastern, Indian, and Thai, any seafood, and fruity deserts.

breweries.name: Cannonball Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Cannonball Creek Brewing Company was founded in January of 2013 by Jason Stengl and Brian Hutchinson.  Jason and Brian met in 2004 at the Mountain Sun family of breweries in Boulder, Colorado were they both learned to hone the craft they love.  With over 15 years of combined professional brewing experience and an uncanny ability to tolerate one another, they decided it was time to take a leap and chase the dream of opening their own brewery.

With both Jason and Brian calling Golden, Colorado home, the choice for a location was obvious.  After settling on a property on the north side of town, they wanted the brewery name to reflect the home town they loved.  After doing some research they learned that the original name for the majestic Clear Creek that runs through the center of Golden was Cannonball Creek.  The historical significance paired with the duo’s love for the iconic Cannonball made the decision a no-brainer and Cannonball Creek Brewing Company was born.

Knowing that they wouldn’t be able to do it all on their own, Jason and Brian called upon former co-worker and professional brewer Jonathan Lee to help run the tasting room and work in the brewery.  Jonathan’s experience as a craft beer bar manager, combined with his professional brewing experience made him the perfect fit.
